programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Don Rickles, Robert Blake, Desi Arnaz, Bob Hope (3/4/76)
programme.desc: Johnny sings Rhinestone Cowboy. Robert Blake talks Baretta, Don Rickles does his trademark insults, Bob Hope shares outtakes from his special, and Desi Arnaz promotes his memoir.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Rich Little, McLean Stevenson, Jean Marsh (5/12/78)
programme.desc: Johnny does his own version of Mr. Rogers. Rich Little impersonates Johnny, McLean Stevenson is doing a new movie, Jean Marsh wakes early for work, Dr. Lendon Smith has a new book.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jimmy Stewart, Don Adams, The Manhattan Transfer (5/14/80)
programme.desc: Carnac the Magnificent stops by. Jimmy Stewart reminisces about his film career. Get Smart's Don Adams has a new movie. The Manhattan Transfer performs.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Angie Dickinson, Garry Shandling, Pilobolus (10/29/81)
programme.desc: Johnny does some card tricks for Angie Dickinson. Garry Shandling performs standup. Johnny joins Pilobolus in their dance routine.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jim Fowler, Tom Hanks (4/8/82)
programme.desc: Carnac the Magnificent needles President Reagan. Wild Kingdom's Jim Fowler brings several animals which terrify Johnny. Tom Hanks preps for fatherhood with lamaze classes.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Billy Crystal, Lucille Thompson (3/27/86)
programme.desc: Johnny pokes fun at Dynasty before getting a martial arts lesson from black belt Lucille Thompson. Billy Crystal regales the audience with celebrity impressions.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Rivers, Jack Lemmon (1/3/73)
programme.desc: Johnny and Joan Rivers admit to stealing hotel soap; Jack Lemmon appears with the legendary director Billy Wilder

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Gunther Gebel-Williams, Sid Caesar, Art Carney, Christopher Plummer (5/18/73)
programme.desc: Gunther Gebel-Williams brings out some circus tigers, Christopher Plummer shares stories from the stage, Art Carney leads Sid Caesar and Johnny in a jazz song.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Bob Hope, Joan Rivers, Michael Landon (9/24/74)
programme.desc: The audience corrects Johnny on when autumn began. Bob Hope has an anniversary special. Joan Rivers appears in a tiara. Michael Landon talks working with kids.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Lucille Ball, The Jackson 5 (11/15/74)
programme.desc: Lucille Ball says she never misses one of Johnny's shows and takes a Cosmopolitan magazine quiz. The Jackson 5 sing two songs and talk about their plans for their time off.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Mel Brooks, The Smothers Brothers, Bob Uecker (7/29/76)
programme.desc: Mel Brooks remembers working in the Catskills and does the 2,000 Year Old Man with Johnny. The Smothers Brothers perform Yo-Yo Man. Bob Uecker talks athlete ailments.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Lucille Ball, Jay Leno, Erma Bombeck (4/28/77)
programme.desc: Lucille Ball and Johnny talk about their legacies. Jay Leno does standup and talks about getting his picture in the local paper. Erma Bombeck shares humorous family stories.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Rivers, Harvey Korman (9/17/75)
programme.desc: Johnny re-enacts the Hamilton and Burr duel. Joan Rivers admits to screaming during childbirth, Harvey Korman is a huge fan of his Carol Burnett Show co-star Tim Conway.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Don Rickles, Robert Blake, Desi Arnaz, Bob Hope (3/4/76)
programme.desc: Johnny sings Rhinestone Cowboy. Robert Blake talks Baretta, Don Rickles does his trademark insults, Bob Hope shares outtakes from his special, and Desi Arnaz promotes his memoir.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jack Benny, Mel Blanc, Jim Henson & The Muppets (1/23/74)
programme.desc: Jack Benny has a lengthy visit, Mel Blanc explains the origin of his signature cartoon voices, Jim Henson and Kermit the Frog sing "It's Not Easy Being Green."

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Dean Martin, Martin Mull (8/9/78)
programme.desc: Dean Martin sips on "apple juice" and Johnny samples it. Martin Mull plays a song in French and will be getting married soon.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jimmy Stewart, Garry Shandling (12/7/82)
programme.desc: Jimmy Stewart wasn't the greatest Boy Scout then reads a poem, Garry Shandling does standup about air travel.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Joan Rivers, Jack Lemmon (1/3/73)
programme.desc: Johnny and Joan Rivers admit to stealing hotel soap; Jack Lemmon appears with the legendary director Billy Wilder

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Gunther Gebel-Williams, Sid Caesar, Art Carney, Christopher Plummer (5/18/73)
programme.desc: Gunther Gebel-Williams brings out some circus tigers, Christopher Plummer shares stories from the stage, Art Carney leads Sid Caesar and Johnny in a jazz song.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Bob Hope, Joan Rivers, Michael Landon (9/24/74)
programme.desc: The audience corrects Johnny on when autumn began. Bob Hope has an anniversary special. Joan Rivers appears in a tiara. Michael Landon talks working with kids.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Lucille Ball, The Jackson 5 (11/15/74)
programme.desc: Lucille Ball says she never misses one of Johnny's shows and takes a Cosmopolitan magazine quiz. The Jackson 5 sing two songs and talk about their plans for their time off.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Mel Brooks, The Smothers Brothers, Bob Uecker (7/29/76)
programme.desc: Mel Brooks remembers working in the Catskills and does the 2,000 Year Old Man with Johnny. The Smothers Brothers perform Yo-Yo Man. Bob Uecker talks athlete ailments.
